page.title: 01Welshcroft Hill :Banbury
page.content: Welshcroft Hill is about 150 m. above sea-level. It is used for rough grazing land. On the top of the hill there is a {circle of trees} that look like they were used for some sort of {magical dance}. There are also some new fir trees that are about 1 metre high. There is a {public footpath} over the hill, but to get to it you have to climb over an old stile. It had a very strange shape as it was steeper one side than the other. It is the sort of place where, if there were such things, fairies would live. It a very bumpy hill, and the bumps look like tiny houses. I would love to visit it on a still and snowy winter's night and sit amongst the trees reaming of strange, weird lands and people. Alison Hastie
